poem:
Ceasefire

At the border, whispers of mercy stumble,
as the sun bakes the bread of compassion.
Children's tears evaporate like dew,
and silos burst with undelivered breath.
The world spins another headline,
and evening comes as it always does—
a faint note in a dissonant symphony,
played on strings stretched to breaking.
